Alec insists he's undercover gathering intelligence, and reassures her that his 'crime' was made up - but Alison has decided to leave him. As they're living in poverty, she takes the boys to Cumberland to stay with her mother. In the 1960s, Alison questions Father Timothy. Faced with conflicting explanations of Alec's past and a startling revelation about his work, she finds herself questioning everything she thought she knew. Drama, starring Ruth Wilson and Iain Glen

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: The detective looks into the suspicious death of an old friend and informant. The investigation leads him to the local police station, where it becomes clear the officers are hiding something - and to complicate matters, the disappearance of a teenage boy is also linked to the case. Crime drama, with Martin Shaw, Lee Ingleby and guest stars Neil Pearson, Dean Lennox Kelly and Mark Benton

programme.title: Dancing on the Edge
programme.desc: Louis is interviewed by police about events on the night of Jessie's attack, telling them he saw Julian when he should have been on a train to Paris. The band are unsettled when a table of racist Germans walks out during a performance at the Imperial Hotel's Christmas Lunch, but Stanley later engineers a fitting revenge. Lady Cremone hosts a New Year's Eve party on her estate and everybody is surprised when Julian turns up, announcing he has been in France exploring a new business idea

programme.title: Dancing on the Edge
programme.desc: The band plays at a dinner at the Imperial Hotel, during which Louis discovers that one of Julian's fellow Freemasons provided him with an alibi for the night Jessie was attacked. Masterson acquires Music Express magazine with Lady Cremone's assistance, and makes Stanley the editor-in-chief. Drama by Stephen Poliakoff, starring Chiwetel Ejiofor, Matthew Goode and John Goodman

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: A terrified Neville is kidnapped, driven through the back streets of Havana and deposited at an empty house - where he is greeted by Pru from the Embassy, who asks him to trap rogue operative Tarquin. Meanwhile, there is still no sign of Barry being released from jail, and his deteriorating condition prompts Oz to make a heartbreaking decision. Kevin Whately, Timothy Spall and Jimmy Nail star

programme.title: Jay Blades' Home Fix
programme.desc: Jay demonstrates how to make a closet organiser, Danny Clark gives a lesson in hedge trimming and Alyse Folwer shows how easy it is to grow cucumbers

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin is on a property hunting mission with a couple who have a £750,000 budget to make a move from the Essex coast to the Suffolk countryside. Aside from the hunt, Jonnie ventures into fields of golden rapeseed to find out how the oil of this humble plant has fast become a store cupboard staple

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp and Philip Serrell continue seeking items of value, on a tour of East Ayrshire and Dumfries and Galloway. Natasha picks up a silver tea caddy and a first edition Virginia Woolf collection of books. Philip discovers just why collecting ancient musical instruments was a status symbol in the 19th century. He also finds a beautiful watercolour by a local artist, but is distracted by some very tasty looking homemade scones

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Ross Kemp hosts the game show, challenging family members Emmanuel, Michael, Debbie and Vivian to find a safe path across the bridge, choosing the truths and avoiding the lies

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and Rylan present the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Zack tries to talk to Whitney about having a memorial for Peach, but she proves evasive - made even worse when Lily has a health scare. Heartbroken Jay cannot believe Lola thinks he is capable of cheating. Chelsea is not best pleased to hear Keanu has agreed to work for Sharon, but Ravi is delighted by the discord, seeing it as a way to manoeuvre his way in

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: An Olympic athlete hopes for a podium finish for her figure skating clothing brand, and a vacuum attachment to combat dust from drilling aims to suck in the cash of Dragons Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett. Plus, a coffee company couple hope they won't be on the receiving end of a roasting for their pitch. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: The Apprentice
programme.desc: Some familiar faces return to interrogate the business plans of the final five and there's tears, turmoil and tough talking as the candidates battle to back their statements and ideas. However, a deep dive into their proposals reveal fictitious figures, crazy concepts and absurd ambitions. For at least one hopeful it's the end of the road as a disgruntled Lord Sugar shows them the door

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce chairs the topical debate from Warrington, Cheshire. Her panellists are Minister in the Department for Energy Security and Net Zero Andrew Bowie MP, Shadow Secretary for Digital, Culture, Media and Sport, Lucy Powell MP, the Scottish National Party's Westminster Leader Stephen Flynn MP, broadcaster and journalist Anne McElvoy and the chairman of Tesco and Barratt Developments, John Allan

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: BBC journalists including Adam Fleming and Chris Mason host a weekly round-up from Westminster, delivering the usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip about the biggest stories in politics

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade takes his turn as host, with comedian Maisie Adam and journalist Justin Webb joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop as they delve into the news headlines of May 2022

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Clive Myrie hosts the celebrity version of the classic quiz. Jayne Middlemiss, Neil Delamere, Harpreet Kaur and Amar Latif are in the famous black chair, answering questions on Duran Duran, the Vikings, The Wolf of Wall Street and Sam Cooke

programme.title: Bill Bailey: Larks in Transit
programme.desc: A stand-up performance by the 2020 Strictly champion in which he became the first British comedian to tread the boards of the Royal Opera House in Covent Garden, sharing tales from more than 20 years as a travelling performer. Topics include Google reviews of Poundland stores, a unique proposal for a Victorian-style Love Island and Old MacDonald sung in the style of Tom Waits. With a guest appearance by soprano Florence Hvorostovsky

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Famous faces from across the BBC offer support as Gethin Jones continues his 24-hour Strictly Come Dancing challenge for Comic Relief

programme.title: Crimewatch Live
programme.desc: Rav Wilding and Michelle Ackerley showcase the work of frontline forces and ask for viewers' help on unsolved cases

programme.title: Critical Incident
programme.desc: In Manchester, plain clothed PCs give chase to a gunman in a residential area. A police officer sustains injuries that put his career in jeopardy when he's involved in a horrific car accident. In Northampton, firearms officers are called upon when a man arrives at a police station claiming he has a bomb

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin is in Stoke-on-Trent, Staffordshire, to revisit a former council depot first seen in January 2015. Tommy Walsh gives a three-bedroom mid-terrace in Enfield, north London the once-over and Martin Roberts wonders what a developer is going to do with two flats squeezed into a Southampton mid-terrace

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Nick Hall and Jonathan Pratt are in Nottinghamshire to help two teams look for items of value at the Newark Antiques and Collectable Fair. Presenter Charlie Ross gets shivers down his spine when he gets to find out more about some spooky antiques. Later, he and the contenders head to the auction in Derby

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: Finn has been off duty for months, but cannot resist getting involved when he sees someone trying to sell drugs on the beach. Marlene unwittingly sabotages an undercover investigation, while Nicole finds an unexpected answer to her fertility problems. Police drama set on the Northern Ireland coast, starring Kerri Quinn

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Resident clock expert Steven Fletcher and ceramics conservator Kirsten Ramsay toil on a fragile 19th-century clock. Several of the porcelain details were broken off when the clock took a tumble several years ago, but with Steve's mind for mechanisms and Kirsten's eye for detail, the pair soon have it looking and sounding as good as new. A broken type writer with a regal connection and a Second World War pilot's leather bomber jacket are also restored

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman embarks on an emotionally charged property search in rural Somerset, helping a couple invest £500,000 in a home that strikes the right balance between country charm and practical open plan. Nicki also visits Barley Wood, a beautiful walled kitchen garden resurrected by chef brothers who use what they grow in their inventive dishes

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp and Phil Serrell go shopping for items of interest in Northern Ireland. Natasha is dazzled by the sight of a bright pink Majolica lotus pattern tea service and the sounds of the Irish fiddle. She even gets a mini masterclass on how to play this centuries old instrument of the Emerald Isle. Philip is feeling the pinch and is desperate to find some profit-making antiques. He scoops up an old bowler hat, a pair of early dumbbells and a mid-19th century worktable that reminds him of his grandmother. The duo later head to their final auction in Wales, where an unexpected bidding frenzy ensues

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Friends and colleagues Tim, Sam, Luke and Damien compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Once they have each faced the bridge on their own, those who have been successful join forces to face the final crossing for a chance to take home the prize. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Comic Relief
programme.desc: Live from MediaCityUK in Salford, David Tennant, Zoe Ball, Paddy McGuinness, Joel Dommett and AJ Odudu host a night jam-packed full with celebrity guests, hilarious sketches and live musical performances. There's a special edition of The Traitors, with Claudia Winkleman, while Kylie Minogue joins forces with the cast of hit BBC sitcom Ghosts in a spook-tacular one-off sketch. Beloved comedy character Baldrick (Tony Robinson) reads his very own Blackadder bedtime story, while the cast of Mrs Doubtfire take to the stage to perform one of the songs from the show, and there is live music from chart-toppers Tom Grennan and Zara Larsson

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Comic Relief
programme.desc: Highlights from 35 years of Red Nose Day which, since its inception in 1985, has raised more than £1billion for a range of vital causes. Among those benefiting this year will those in the UK struggling to afford food and the people of Turkey and Syria affected by the recent earthquake

programme.title: The Peanut Butter Falcon (2019)
programme.desc: A young man with Down's syndrome runs away from the nursing home where he lives to chase his dream of becoming a professional wrestler by attending specialist school the Salt Water Redneck. There, he joins forces with a small-time outlaw on the run, who becomes his unlikely coach and ally. Light-hearted adventure, starring Shia LaBeouf, Bruce Dern and Zack Gottsagen

programme.title: Six Nations Sin Bin
programme.desc: Gabby Logan and Gareth Thomas are joined by stand-up, actor and broadcaster Patrick Kielty, comedian Zoe Lyons and former Wales captain Colin Charvis to reflect on this year's Six Nations championship. The Sin Bin Road Trip is back in Glasgow as JJ Chalmers and Aimee Fuller take on British and Irish Lion Gordon Bulloch in a line-out challenge

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Theo Randall and Philli Armitage-Mattin plus special guest Fleur East. Helen McGinn picks the wines to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott and guests look ahead to the weekend's fixtures, including matches in the Premier League and the sixth round of the FA Cup

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Live Six Nations Rugby Union
programme.desc: Scotland v Italy (Kick-off 12.30pm). Gabby Logan presents all the action from the opening match in the final round of fixtures, held at BT Murrayfield. Scotland recorded a 33-22 victory when the sides met in Rome last year and have enjoyed some encouraging results this time around, though defeats to France and Ireland mean they no longer have a chance of winning the title. Italy have been competitive in all their matches so far, but are still without a win. With analysis from Martin Johnson and John Barclay, and commentary by Andrew Cotter, Sam Warburton and Chris Paterson

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: EJ Osborne searches for three items he can rescue and revamp at the recycling centre in Woking. An old plans chest needs some careful reworking at the hands of restorers Tom and Johnny, while woodworking wizard Norman Wilkinson is challenged with creating high-end furniture from a set of discarded garden chairs. EJ himself attempts to repurpose a pair of swivel stools

programme.title: Comic Relief
programme.desc: Highlight's of this year's Red Nose Day

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Burnley (Kick-off 5.45pm). All the action from the sixth-round tie at Etihad Stadium. Burnley are managed by former City captain Vincent Kompany, who won this trophy twice while at the club. The Clarets have performed well under his stewardship and look set for an immediate return to the Premier League. However, they face the toughest of tests against the cup favourites, who tend to be particularly ruthless against lower league opposition, as shown in their 3-0 win away to Bristol City in the previous round. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Micah Richards

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian is back with his colossal spinning wheel, offering three contestants the chance to secure the final cash prize - but only one of them can play for the jackpot. Helping them along the way are celebrity experts Jonathan Ross on Comic Books, Vick Hope on Pop Music, Gareth Thomas on Rugby, Victoria Derbyshire on News, Tom Allen on Gardening, Chunkz on Maths, and Sara Cox on Dogs

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Charlie questions his loyalties when Robyn is brought into the ED following a car crash just as the department reaches breaking point, with limited staff available to treat her. David and Marty make a difficult decision, Jacob realises his actions might have devastating consequences, and Faith makes a horrifying discovery

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee thinks the twins are too young to be taught about sex at school and that their teacher Miss Anstis is too stuck up to teach it. He resolves that it is his duty as a father to teach his children everything he knows about the facts of life, discovering only when it is too late that his knowledge is somewhat limited. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Chelsea v Everton at Stamford Bridge and Southampton v Tottenham Hotspur at St Mary's Stadium. Chelsea and the Toffees have both endured seasons to forget so far and will have been looking to get back on track with three points. Meanwhile, Spurs continued their bid to finish in the top four when they took on the relegation-threatened Saints. Plus, Aston Villa v Bournemouth, Brentford v Leicester City and Wolverhampton Wanderers v Leeds United

programme.title: Halloween (2018)
programme.desc: Four decades ago, Michael Myers terrorised the town of Haddonfield, Illinois and went on a killing spree, 15 years after murdering his sister. After a prison bus crashes, the killer is back in the wild, but survivor Laurie Strode is ready for his return. Director David Gordon Green's horror sequel based on John Carpenter's much imitated 1978 namesake movie. With Jamie Lee Curtis, returning to the franchise for the first time since 2002's Halloween Resurrection, Judy Greer and Andi Matichak

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Natasha and Phil continue on their antiquing adventure. While Natasha uncovers an early silver sandwich box and a Scottish spirit kettle, Phil finds a Victorian fish service

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice Roberts heads to a farmer's field in Rutland to examine evidence of a Roman barn conversion, featuring a three-room spa, including underfloor and in-wall central heating. She also finds out about the excavation of one of Henry VIII's lost forts in Hull, and hears from a team that discovered stunning 10,000-year-old hunting tools near Scarborough

programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: Eggheads

programme.title: Eggheads

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers create classic puddings and explore the history and traditions behind Britain's favourite desserts. They also take part in the world black-pudding throwing competition in Lancashire

programme.title: Land of the Lost Wolves
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Gordon Buchanan presents a two-part programme documenting the return of wolves to the snowy peaks of Washington's Cascade Mountains. He charts the fortunes of first pack to live in the north-west of America in 70 years after all but being wiped out across the country

programme.title: Priceless Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Highlights of the long-running TV series, featuring furniture expert Lennox Cato offering tips on collecting, and Penny Brittain learning about textile conservation. Presented by Fiona Bruce

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Mark Stacey and Catherine Southon assess items at Margam Country Park in South Wales, while presenter Paul Martin visits the birthplace of one of his heroes, a Welshman who took Hollywood by storm

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Reeta Chakrabarti, Olga Koch, Andrew Maxwell and Gareth Thomas test their general knowledge skills in the week's penultimate edition

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Edith Bowman explore the food festival in Cockermouth in Cumbria, meeting passionate food producers and getting tips on homemade pitta bread from a MasterChef winner. Food journalist Leyla Kazim reveals the secrets of tomato growing and heads to Northumbria in search of the best local fish at the best price. Baker Briony May Williams finds out why Cumbria is the home of sticky toffee pudding

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: On Ireland's south-east coast, the three RNLI crews at Dunmore East, Kilmore Quay and Rosslare battle to save a cargo ship that has lost all power and is drifting towards rocks. In Hoylake, on the Wirral, a vast multi-agency effort is required to rescue a mother and daughter who have got stuck in the mud and, 65 miles to the west, in the coastal village of Porthdinllaen, the crew respond to a mayday call from a yacht five miles out in the Irish Sea that is requesting an immediate medical evacuation

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two highest scoring chefs from Northern Ireland go head to head and cook their six-course menus again, hoping to impress judges Tom Kerridge, Nisha Katona and Ed Gamble with their creations. The pair will also have to dazzle guest judge Oliver Jeffers, the award-winning author and artist, as he helps to decide which chef will make it to the final

programme.title: Murder in the Pacific
programme.desc: In the final part of the story, we hear from the bomber, how he came to plant the bombs on the Greenpeace ship Rainbow Warrior, and the measures he took to escape New Zealand after the attack. He and another suspect reveal the origins of the mission - the French government convincing them that the KGB had infiltrated Greenpeace

programme.title: The Apprentice: You're Fired
programme.desc: The latest candidate to leave the competition joins Tom Allen to talk about their time on the show, while a panel of celebrity fans and business experts give their thoughts on the unfortunate entrepreneur's progress

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Slammed: The Seventies
programme.desc: After becoming famous across the world, expectation levels are at an all-time high when the Welsh players return home

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Two years ago, patient Karl sustained a brain injury after falling downstairs, as a result of which surgeons had to leave a portion of his skull missing to stop his brain from swelling. Today, neurosurgeon Ryan Mathew intends to rebuild his skull - but at the moment, a hospital bed cannot be found. Meanwhile, consultant Sheila Fraser removes a tumour believed to be the size of a football from a patient's abdomen and a seven-year-old has metal pins removed from his legs, now his broken limbs have healed

programme.title: The Warship: Tour of Duty
programme.desc: After six months at sea on its first operational deployment, HMS Queen Elizabeth departs the Pacific for the long voyage home. After crossing the Arabian Sea, the ship stops at Duqm in Oman to replenish stores, before proceeding up the Red Sea, through the Suez canal and into the eastern Mediterranean. An F35 jet on a routine launch loses power at a critical moment and the pilot has to eject, and HMS Queen Elizabeth launches a search and rescue mission to locate the airman

programme.title: Rip Off Britain: Holidays
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Julia Somerville and Gloria Hunniford investigate consumers' disastrous holidays and travel troubles - from caravans that didn't live up to the marketing material, to world cruises that proved tricky to insure. Plus, top tips on how to travel safely

programme.title: Scarlett's Driving School
programme.desc: Fatemah has still never taken a driving test despite learning to drive for eight years. It has fallen to the 25-year-old's adoring but nerve-shattered dad Akil to instruct her. But as Scarlett Moffatt's experts discover, the driving may not be the problem

programme.desc: Natasha and Phil continue their journey to Glasgow where they find some French candlesticks, an Italian paperweight and a combo lot of weighty farm troughs

Plus, Carol Klein pays an inspirational trip to an early summer garden in Wiltshire, and Toby Buckland meets a woman in Devon who has created and nurtured her garden over the last 60 years

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the British tradition of cooking with food hunted from the land and prepare a selection of dishes using rabbit, grouse and venison

programme.title: Land of the Lost Wolves
programme.desc: In the conclusion of the two-part documentary following the lives of a wolf pack in North America, wildlife cameraman Gordon Buchanan and the team discover most of the animals have been killed by locals. However, as they try to find out whether any of the predators survived, there is a glimmer of hope on the horizon

programme.title: Priceless Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Experts who have featured on past series of Antiques Roadshow share their favourite memories of the long-running TV favourite. Presented by Fiona Bruce

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: The team are at Herstmonceux Castle in Sussex, where antiques experts James Lewis and Catherine Southon unearth treasures brought in by visitors to sell at auction. A Chinese wall plaque catches James's eye and Paul Martin explores the history of Herstmonceux Castle

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Reeta Chakrabarti, Olga Koch, Andrew Maxwell and Gareth Thomas test their general knowledge skills before the week's winner is announced

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Edith Bowman and Colin Murray explore the Foodies Festival in Glasgow, where they discover the secrets to the best egg fried rice with chef Jimmy Lee and how to spot fake vanilla. Chef Julie Lin digs deep to reveal some myths about frozen food and farmer Jim Smith learns the art of pickling, and discovers why one farm is turning its oats into milk

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: Just off the west coast of Scotland, on the rugged Isle of Mull, the Tobermory lifeboat crew have to battle huge waves to save a 40-foot fishing boat that's lost all power. On the Pembrokeshire coast, the crew are called out to reports of an injured fisherman onboard a Belgian trawler

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don and the team are back with a celebration of spring. As well as getting on with some essential rose pruning, the host will be planting clematis and rocket, cutting back grasses and making a start on sowing annuals for colour this summer. Plus, Carol Klein visits Colesbourne Gardens in Gloucestershire to revel in their vibrant displays of spring colour

programme.title: Becoming Frida Kahlo
programme.desc: Frida and Diego travel to San Francisco where he has an important mural commission. Her style stirs much excitement, and Frida is determined to succeed in her own right in the face of Diego's affairs. Shocked by the vast gap between rich and poor that she witnesses in Depression-era New York, she struggles to hide her disdain for high society

programme.title: When Comic Relief Did Big Brother
programme.desc: In 2001, six celebrities entered the Big Brother house in honour of Comic Relief. It was eight days that had the nation hooked and helped raise millions of pounds. Twenty-two years on since the original broadcast, winner Jack Dee and fellow housemates Vanessa Feltz, Claire Sweeney, Keith Duffy and Anthea Turner take a look back at this moment in television history

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Faisal Islam

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: MOTDx
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas and the team reveal more of the lifestyle and culture that surrounds the Premier League and those involved in it

programme.title: Couples Therapy
programme.desc: Ping and Will face the truth. India and Dale share insights about their work with Orna

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: Back from his travels, Dave continues to hold his own feet to the creative fire, but the world has conspired to throw every possible distraction at him - including the prospect of seeing Ally again for the first time since they broke up

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: Benny and Dave's friendship blossoms in strange and unexpected ways, leading them to confront questions of privilege, race, sexuality, and dermatology. Meanwhile, Mike's isolation deepens and a chance encounter sheds light on the root of his anger

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Every year, scammers steal billions from the public, and fraud now represents around 40 per cent of all reported crime in the UK. Over the last year, Panorama has had exclusive access to Kent Police as their detectives try to catch the fraudsters. The programme explores why so few cases are prosecuted and shows how fraudsters target the vulnerable, often using sophisticated techniques to dupe victims

programme.title: Parole
programme.desc: An inside look at the high-stakes world of parole hearings, where the futures of prisoners hang in the balance, as well of that of the victims and/or their families. The first episode follows 54-year-old Colin, who committed murder following a pub fight 25 years ago, as he hopes for a chance to be released from prison. Later, serial fraudster David, who spent four decades swindling thousands of pounds out of the women he dated, tries to convince the parole board he is a changed man

programme.title: Our Flag Means Death
programme.desc: At the mercy of Chauncy and the British, Stede and Blackbeard renounce their pirating ways in a desperate attempt to escape execution. Afterwards, life offshore promises new opportunities, but a late-night confrontation threatens the future of Stede and Blackbeard's friendship. Stuck under the thumb of a new captain, the crew considers mutiny once again

programme.title: Gary Lineker: My Grandad's War
programme.desc: The Match of the Day presenter retraces the footsteps of his grandfather Stanley Abbs to explore a brutal but often overlooked chapter of the Second World War. Using the official war diary kept by Stanley's unit as a guide, Gary revisits the places where he was stationed and meets experts who help him piece together what happened to his grandfather during the Italian campaign. Along the way, Gary meets veterans who share first-hand testimonies to and help him understand the reality of combat in Italy

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: As Peggee and the Hummingbirds journey up the river to deliver a parcel, they have fun spotting and avoiding the wildlife that they meet along the way

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: Bitzer is left with a mountain of work when the farmer is rendered incapable

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: Deep in the caverns below Beanotown town hall, a mysterious species of over-sized hamsters may or may not exist, so may or may not be at risk of being hunted down and turned into fluffy slippers

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: The kids get a chance to run Miss Skippy's new food kiosk, where Mouse starts serving his own 'perfect' chilli

programme.title: The Football Academy
programme.desc: After impressing in her own age group, U16s attacking midfielder Dream gets the chance to play up for the senior U18s team

programme.title: The Dengineers
programme.desc: Goalkeeper and football fan Tristan had to take a break from playing with his local team due to illness. He wants a den to help him recover and to store his football memorabilia

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The doctors investigate how lungs move, with the help of a huge water slide

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: The presenters kick-off Red Nose Day

programme.title: Deadly Pole to Pole
programme.desc: Steve Backshall experiences extremely cold conditions, and discovers how animals in the frozen corners of Earth survive in sub-zero temperatures

programme.title: Deadly Pole to Pole
programme.desc: Steve Backshall and his daring crew explore the elemental furies of fire, ice, water and wind by taking a look at some of the most deadly forces of nature on the planet

programme.title: Life in the Air
programme.desc: The series turns to animals that fly, including footage of half a million mother bats, an agile sparrowhawk raiding for food, and large beetles taking to the sky as part of their mating ritual. The programme also reveals how peregrine falcons are able to reach speeds of 200mph, and why an albatross's nose helps it to fly. Narrated by Suranne Jones

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef travels to the far west of Cornwall to meet a potter whose work captures the rugged beauty of her surroundings. Then to the far east, on the trail of the poet Charles Causley, who spent his life in the Cornish border town of Launceston. There, Rick meets another Cornish writer, Patrick Gale, who has written a book on Causley's life, and considers him this country's greatest Second World War poet. Rick also whips up his favourite seabass dish

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Presenters visit food festivals across the UK, beginning with Edith Bowman and Colin Murray at the Stranraer Oyster Festival, as celebrations mark the start of the native oyster season. They sail into Loch Ryan to Scotland's largest oyster bed to discover why they're so special. Chef Julie Lin discovers bargains in the World Food aisles, and gets the lowdown on low fat, semi-skimmed and full fat milk, while farmer Jim Smith gets stuck into some sticky sweets

programme.title: Celebrity Best Home Cook
programme.desc: Mary Berry challenges the celebrity cooks to prepare the perfect breakfast for houseguests. Two of the contestants adopt a Mexican theme, pitting quesadillas against breakfast burritos, while another presents the judges with an edible crossword. Mary and fellow judges Angela Hartnett and Chris Bavin each select their favourite dish, but even this is no protection against being eliminated from the contest. Claudia Winkleman presents

programme.title: Doctor Zhivago (1965)
programme.desc: A married Russian physician falls in love with another woman, but as their passionate affair plays out against the raging backdrop of the First World War and the Bolshevik revolution, he is torn between his desires and his loyalty to his wife. David Lean's epic drama based on Boris Pasternak's novel, starring Omar Sharif, Julie Christie, Geraldine Chaplin, Rod Steiger, Alec Guinness, Ralph Richardson, Tom Courtenay and Klaus Kinski

programme.title: The Real Marigold on Tour
programme.desc: Paul Nicholas, Sheila Ferguson, Wayne Sleep and Jan Leeming embark on an adventure in the capital of Argentina, Buenos Aires, first paying a visit to a late night Tango event where they spend the night dancing with the locals. The following day, the group explore what the cultural capital of Argentina has on offer. Having duetted together in the past, Sheila and Paul book a Tango singing lesson, while Wayne and Jan enrol in a life drawing class. For their final night in Buenos Aires, Sheila and Paul find a venue where they can perform the Tango song they learned earlier in the week

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Thomas Plant and Catherine Southon value items at London Zoo in Regent's Park, while presenter Paul Martin visits the Victoria and Albert Museum in Kensington to examine its fascinating history and explore the architecture gallery

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Comedians Rufus Hound and Chris McCausland join antiques experts Margie Cooper and Ochuko Ojiri in Merseyside. There are lots of laughs and bags of buys, but will there be profits aplenty?

programme.title: Saving Lives at Sea
programme.desc: In Portrush, Co Antrim, the crew race to rescue a boy who has got into difficulties after jumping off rocks, and one of the crew volunteers enters the water to save him. On the Pembrokeshire coast, the lifeguard team at Whitesands Beach join forces with the St David lifeboat crew to rescue someone who has been found unconscious in the water

programme.title: Universe
programme.desc: In the final episode of the series, Brian Cox asks how the universe came to be. Throughout the programme, he explores how cutting-edge space missions have revealed the origin of the universe, how discoveries have helped scientists understand how we came to be here and the technology they have used along the way, from NASA's Hubble Space Telescope to the European Space Agency's Planck space telescope

programme.title: Chaka Khan at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of appearance by the American singer on the BBC over the course of five decades, featuring her number one hit I Feel For You, as well as I'm Every Woman, and Ain't Nobody in partnership with Rufus

programme.title: Aretha Franklin: Duets
programme.desc: Admirers including Elton John, Gloria Estefan, Smokey Robinson, PM Dawn, Bonnie Raitt and Rod Stewart share a stage with the Queen of Soul. The concert took place at Manhattan's Nederlander Theatre in 1993, as an AIDS benefit. Elton, Smokey and Rod provide backing vocals on the first number Chain of Fools

programme.title: Randy Crawford at Drury Lane
programme.desc: A 1981 concert at the Theatre Royal in London's West End by the American jazz and R&B singer, whose hits include One Day I'll Fly Away and You Might Need Somebody

programme.title: Queens of Soul
programme.desc: A compilation of archive footage to celebrate the critically-acclaimed female singers whose voices have come to define the soul genre, including Aretha Franklin, Roberta Flack, Gladys Knight, Randy Crawford, Angie Stone, Mary J Blige and Beyonce

programme.title: Northern Soul (2014)
programme.desc: A teenager living in a Northern town in the 1970s finds his horizons expanded when he discovers American soul music. He develops an inseparable friendship with a fellow devotee and the pair hope to achieve a brighter future beyond their bleak daily life. Drama, starring Elliot James Langridge, Josh Whitehouse, Steve Coogan and Ricky Tomlinson

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: When basketball legend Kareem Abdul-Jabbar finds out that Lil Dicky made a song about him, Dave gets a chance to meet his hero

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: Gata has a night out, and Dave and Elz's friendship is tested when they perform together at a bar mitzvah. Comedy, starring Dave Burd and Travis Bennett

programme.title: Dave
programme.desc: An exclusive online dating app leads to Dave being matched with pop star Doja Cat, and technological courtship ensues as he gets caught up in the excitement of a modern-day romance

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo reaches Bodmin en route to Totnes, as he explores the West Country from St Ives to Salisbury Plain. Out on the rugged moor, Michael hears how the celebrated author Daphne du Maurier captivated readers between the wars with her tales of smuggling at the Jamaica Inn. In Devon, Michael takes the plunge at Plymouth's beautiful art deco Tinside Lido, while at Ivybridge, he boards a vehicle like no other to cross the causeway to Burgh Island, where a 1930s playboy built a splendid art deco party palace

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales
programme.desc: Adventurer Paul Rose's trip concludes in Wharfedale, where he talks to some of the women whose story inspired the film Calendar Girls, finds out why bats are under threat in the area and meets families from inner-city Bradford who are having their first Dales experience

programme.title: Michael Caine: Acting in Film
programme.desc: The Oscar-winner gives a masterclass on the craft of acting for the movie camera, conducting a workshop with five actors using scenes from some of his films. From 1987

programme.title: The Ipcress File (1965)
programme.desc: An intelligence agent investigating the kidnap and brainwashing of Britain's most renowned scientists unpicks a complex chain of connections and high-level intrigue, while detecting evidence of double-dealing and counter-espionage. Spy thriller based on Len Deighton's novel, starring Michael Caine, Sue Lloyd, Gordon Jackson and Nigel Green

programme.title: Funeral in Berlin (1966)
programme.desc: Former crook and disreputable spy Harry Palmer has to carefully engineer the defection of a Russian officer responsible for safeguarding vital military secrets - but the mission proves less than straightforward. Cold War thriller and the second film to feature Len Deighton's character, starring Michael Caine, Eva Renzi, Oscar Homolka, Paul Hubschmid and Guy Doleman

programme.title: Chris Packham's Animal Einsteins
programme.desc: The presenter introduces a look at animals with impressive communication skills, discovering how white-throated sparrows use song to attract mates and the complex vocabulary of prairie dogs. The programme reveals how dolphins are able to address each other by name and chimpanzees use sign language, and also reveals species that communicate using ultrasound, vibrations and parts of the light spectrum beyond the ability of human sense to process

programme.desc: Bruno Brookes and Alice Cooper host the chart show from May 19, 1994, presenting songs by Deep Forest, 2 Unlimited, Bad Boys Inc, Wet Wet Wet, Seal, Julia Fordham, East 17, the Manchester United Football Club squad and Alice himself

programme.title: Phil Lynott: Songs for While I'm Away
programme.desc: The life and music of the Thin Lizzy frontman, telling the story of how a young working-class Black boy from 1950s Dublin became one of Ireland's greatest rock stars. Told extensively through the words of Lynott himself and focusing on some of his iconic songs, the film gets to the heart of Philip as a father, husband, friend, son and rock legend, who died at the age of 36 in January 1986

Michael begins his odyssey in Spain, where he explores bullfighting in Valencia, before heading for Africa to see the spectacular Mount Kilimanjaro

programme.title: Michael Palin: Travels of a Lifetime
programme.desc: Michael Palin revisits his travel series, beginning with Around the World in 80 Days. He draws on his personal archive of audio recordings and diary notebooks, and reflects on how he became a seasoned global traveller. The first episode revisits his visits to Venice, Cairo, Saudi Arabia, India, Hong Kong and China - a nation that was closed to most westerners at the time. Featuring contributions from fans and friends including David Attenborough, Joanna Lumley and Simon Reeve

programme.title: My Life
programme.desc: Jamie dreams of becoming a fisherman, working alongside his dad on their boat, the Silver Queen. He lives on the Lizard Peninsula, the UK’s most southerly point. Over the course of a year, we discover what it is like to live as part of a close family and community in a tiny traditional Cornish coastal village. We see how Jamie’s life is impacted by the ebb and flow of the seasons as the tourists come and go, and the winter storms roll in stopping the boats from heading out. He continues to learn the family business and explore what the future might hold for the next generation of Cornish fishermen. Will Jamie keep his heart set on the sea and a life as one of the sons of Cadgwith Cove?

It's Makeover Day, and they want to make over Elder Kitten's living room while he gets a relaxing makeover himself at the Fluffytown spa. When they finish, Love Monster thinks it's very different from Elder Kitten's usual style. He starts to wonder whether Elder Kitten will be good surprised or bad surprised. Just then, Elder Kitten returns from his spa day. Bad Idea Puppy and Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny show him his new living room and explain that they decorated with the best bright things they could think of. As Elder Kitten looks on a little unsure, Love Monster asks him whether he loves it. Natasha is dazzled by the sight of a bright pink Majolica lotus pattern tea service and the sounds of the Irish fiddle. She even gets a mini masterclass on how to play this centuries old instrument of the Emerald Isle. Philip is feeling the pinch and is desperate to find some profit-making antiques. He scoops up an old bowler hat, a pair of early dumbbells and a mid-19th century worktable that reminds him of his grandmother. The duo later head to their final auction in Wales, where an unexpected bidding frenzy ensues

programme.desc: Clive Myrie hosts the celebrity version of the classic quiz. Jayne Middlemiss, Neil Delamere, Harpreet Kaur and Amar Latif are in the famous black chair, answering questions on Duran Duran, the Vikings, The Wolf of Wall Street and Sam Cooke

programme.title: Bill Bailey: Larks in Transit
programme.desc: A stand-up performance by the 2020 Strictly champion in which he became the first British comedian to tread the boards of the Royal Opera House in Covent Garden, sharing tales from more than 20 years as a travelling performer. programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin is in Stoke-on-Trent, Staffordshire, to revisit a former council depot first seen in January 2015. Tommy Walsh gives a three-bedroom mid-terrace in Enfield, north London the once-over and Martin Roberts wonders what a developer is going to do with two flats squeezed into a Southampton mid-terrace

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Nick Hall and Jonathan Pratt are in Nottinghamshire to help two teams look for items of value at the Newark Antiques and Collectable Fair. programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Hope Street
programme.desc: Finn has been off duty for months, but cannot resist getting involved when he sees someone trying to sell drugs on the beach. Marlene unwittingly sabotages an undercover investigation, while Nicole finds an unexpected answer to her fertility problems. Police drama set on the Northern Ireland coast, starring Kerri Quinn

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Resident clock expert Steven Fletcher and ceramics conservator Kirsten Ramsay toil on a fragile 19th-century clock. Several of the porcelain details were broken off when the clock took a tumble several years ago, but with Steve's mind for mechanisms and Kirsten's eye for detail, the pair soon have it looking and sounding as good as new. A broken type writer with a regal connection and a Second World War pilot's leather bomber jacket are also restored

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman embarks on an emotionally charged property search in rural Somerset, helping a couple invest £500,000 in a home that strikes the right balance between country charm and practical open plan. Nicki also visits Barley Wood, a beautiful walled kitchen garden resurrected by chef brothers who use what they grow in their inventive dishes

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp and Phil Serrell go shopping for items of interest in Northern Ireland. Natasha is dazzled by the sight of a bright pink Majolica lotus pattern tea service and the sounds of the Irish fiddle. She even gets a mini masterclass on how to play this centuries old instrument of the Emerald Isle. Philip is feeling the pinch and is desperate to find some profit-making antiques. He scoops up an old bowler hat, a pair of early dumbbells and a mid-19th century worktable that reminds him of his grandmother. The duo later head to their final auction in Wales, where an unexpected bidding frenzy ensues

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Friends and colleagues Tim, Sam, Luke and Damien compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Once they have each faced the bridge on their own, those who have been successful join forces to face the final crossing for a chance to take home the prize. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Richard Osman

programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: Comic Relief
programme.desc: Live from MediaCityUK in Salford, David Tennant, Zoe Ball, Paddy McGuinness, Joel Dommett and AJ Odudu host a night jam-packed full with celebrity guests, hilarious sketches and live musical performances. There's a special edition of The Traitors, with Claudia Winkleman, while Kylie Minogue joins forces with the cast of hit BBC sitcom Ghosts in a spook-tacular one-off sketch. Beloved comedy character Baldrick (Tony Robinson) reads his very own Blackadder bedtime story, while the cast of Mrs Doubtfire take to the stage to perform one of the songs from the show, and there is live music from chart-toppers Tom Grennan and Zara Larsson

programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.desc: Highlights from 35 years of Red Nose Day which, since its inception in 1985, has raised more than £1billion for a range of vital causes. programme.title: A View from the Terrace

programme.title: The Peanut Butter Falcon (2019)
programme.desc: A young man with Down's syndrome runs away from the nursing home where he lives to chase his dream of becoming a professional wrestler by attending specialist school the Salt Water Redneck. There, he joins forces with a small-time outlaw on the run, who becomes his unlikely coach and ally. Light-hearted adventure, starring Shia LaBeouf, Bruce Dern and Zack Gottsagen

programme.title: Six Nations Sin Bin
programme.desc: Gabby Logan and Gareth Thomas are joined by stand-up, actor and broadcaster Patrick Kielty, comedian Zoe Lyons and former Wales captain Colin Charvis to reflect on this year's Six Nations championship. The Sin Bin Road Trip is back in Glasgow as JJ Chalmers and Aimee Fuller take on British and Irish Lion Gordon Bulloch in a line-out challenge

programme.title: Live Six Nations Rugby Union
programme.desc: Scotland v Italy (Kick-off 12.30pm). Gabby Logan presents all the action from the opening match in the final round of fixtures, held at BT Murrayfield. Scotland recorded a 33-22 victory when the sides met in Rome last year and have enjoyed some encouraging results this time around, though defeats to France and Ireland mean they no longer have a chance of winning the title. Italy have been competitive in all their matches so far, but are still without a win. With analysis from Martin Johnson and John Barclay, and commentary by Andrew Cotter, Sam Warburton and Chris Paterson

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: EJ Osborne searches for three items he can rescue and revamp at the recycling centre in Woking. An old plans chest needs some careful reworking at the hands of restorers Tom and Johnny, while woodworking wizard Norman Wilkinson is challenged with creating high-end furniture from a set of discarded garden chairs. EJ himself attempts to repurpose a pair of swivel stools

programme.title: Comic Relief
programme.desc: Highlight's of this year's Red Nose Day

programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Burnley (Kick-off 5.45pm). All the action from the sixth-round tie at Etihad Stadium. Burnley are managed by former City captain Vincent Kompany, who won this trophy twice while at the club. The Clarets have performed well under his stewardship and look set for an immediate return to the Premier League. However, they face the toughest of tests against the cup favourites, who tend to be particularly ruthless against lower league opposition, as shown in their 3-0 win away to Bristol City in the previous round. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Micah Richards

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian is back with his colossal spinning wheel, offering three contestants the chance to secure the final cash prize - but only one of them can play for the jackpot. Helping them along the way are celebrity experts Jonathan Ross on Comic Books, Vick Hope on Pop Music, Gareth Thomas on Rugby, Victoria Derbyshire on News, Tom Allen on Gardening, Chunkz on Maths, and Sara Cox on Dogs

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Charlie questions his loyalties when Robyn is brought into the ED following a car crash just as the department reaches breaking point, with limited staff available to treat her. David and Marty make a difficult decision, Jacob realises his actions might have devastating consequences, and Faith makes a horrifying discovery

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee thinks the twins are too young to be taught about sex at school and that their teacher Miss Anstis is too stuck up to teach it. He resolves that it is his duty as a father to teach his children everything he knows about the facts of life, discovering only when it is too late that his knowledge is somewhat limited. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton

programme.title: Comic Relief
programme.desc: Highlights from 35 years of Red Nose Day which, since its inception in 1985, has raised more than £1billion for a range of vital causes. Among those benefiting this year will those in the UK struggling to afford food and the people of Turkey and Syria affected by the recent earthquake

programme.title: Jerk
programme.desc: Tim lands himself a role as an extra in a period biopic about a famous disabled musician. When some campaigners kick up a fuss about the star lead - James Norton - not being disabled, Tim is recast as the lead in a knee-jerk reaction to avoid media backlash. The bosses are so concerned with optics surrounding disability, they completely disregard the authenticity of the film - Tim doesn't even have the right disability and aside from that, cannot act to save his life. Chaos therefore ensues as he brings the production to its knees. Tim Renkow stars in this comedy a cerebral palsy sufferer who uses his condition to get away with saying what others are unable to

programme.title: Jerk
programme.desc: Tim falls foul of the local drug dealer after accidentally walking off with a load of her weed. His skin is saved when she realises that as a disabled man he is an ideal candidate to become an unlikely drug mule. After getting the gig, he soon realises it isn't as fun as it looks on TV. Meanwhile, Ruth is left to look after a care dog that Tim's been sent by Mom. Snuffles is way too good at his job for Ruth's liking and she sets out to educate him on what being a carer is really about. Comedy, starring Tim Renkow and Sharon Rooney

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade takes his turn as host, with comedian Maisie Adam and journalist Justin Webb joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop as they delve into the news headlines of May 2022

programme.title: Suzie Lee: Home Cook Hero
programme.desc: Suzie Lee Arbuthnot, winner of the BBC's Best Home Cook competition, shows how to prepare and present a spectacular chicken superfood salad

programme.title: Six Nations Sin Bin
programme.desc: Gabby Logan and Gareth Thomas are joined by stand-up, actor and broadcaster Patrick Kielty, comedian Zoe Lyons and former Wales captain Colin Charvis to reflect on this year's Six Nations championship. The Sin Bin Road Trip is back in Glasgow as JJ Chalmers and Aimee Fuller take on British and Irish Lion Gordon Bulloch in a line-out challenge

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by chefs Theo Randall and Philli Armitage-Mattin plus special guest Fleur East. Helen McGinn picks the wines to go with the studio dishes

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott and guests look ahead to the weekend's fixtures, including matches in the Premier League and the sixth round of the FA Cup

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Live Six Nations Rugby Union
programme.desc: Scotland v Italy (Kick-off 12.30pm). Gabby Logan presents all the action from the opening match in the final round of fixtures, held at BT Murrayfield. Scotland recorded a 33-22 victory when the sides met in Rome last year and have enjoyed some encouraging results this time around, though defeats to France and Ireland mean they no longer have a chance of winning the title. Italy have been competitive in all their matches so far, but are still without a win. With analysis from Martin Johnson and John Barclay, and commentary by Andrew Cotter, Sam Warburton and Chris Paterson

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: EJ Osborne searches for three items he can rescue and revamp at the recycling centre in Woking. An old plans chest needs some careful reworking at the hands of restorers Tom and Johnny, while woodworking wizard Norman Wilkinson is challenged with creating high-end furniture from a set of discarded garden chairs. EJ himself attempts to repurpose a pair of swivel stools

programme.title: Comic Relief
programme.desc: Highlight's of this year's Red Nose Day

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Match of the Day Live: The FA Cup
programme.desc: Manchester City v Burnley (Kick-off 5.45pm). All the action from the sixth-round tie at Etihad Stadium. Burnley are managed by former City captain Vincent Kompany, who won this trophy twice while at the club. The Clarets have performed well under his stewardship and look set for an immediate return to the Premier League. However, they face the toughest of tests against the cup favourites, who tend to be particularly ruthless against lower league opposition, as shown in their 3-0 win away to Bristol City in the previous round. With analysis from Alan Shearer and Micah Richards

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian is back with his colossal spinning wheel, offering three contestants the chance to secure the final cash prize - but only one of them can play for the jackpot. Helping them along the way are celebrity experts Jonathan Ross on Comic Books, Vick Hope on Pop Music, Gareth Thomas on Rugby, Victoria Derbyshire on News, Tom Allen on Gardening, Chunkz on Maths, and Sara Cox on Dogs

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Charlie questions his loyalties when Robyn is brought into the ED following a car crash just as the department reaches breaking point, with limited staff available to treat her. David and Marty make a difficult decision, Jacob realises his actions might have devastating consequences, and Faith makes a horrifying discovery

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee thinks the twins are too young to be taught about sex at school and that their teacher Miss Anstis is too stuck up to teach it. He resolves that it is his duty as a father to teach his children everything he knows about the facts of life, discovering only when it is too late that his knowledge is somewhat limited. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Chelsea v Everton at Stamford Bridge and Southampton v Tottenham Hotspur at St Mary's Stadium. Chelsea and the Toffees have both endured seasons to forget so far and will have been looking to get back on track with three points. Meanwhile, Spurs continued their bid to finish in the top four when they took on the relegation-threatened Saints. Plus, Aston Villa v Bournemouth, Brentford v Leicester City and Wolverhampton Wanderers v Leeds United

programme.title: Halloween (2018)
programme.desc: Four decades ago, Michael Myers terrorised the town of Haddonfield, Illinois and went on a killing spree, 15 years after murdering his sister. After a prison bus crashes, the killer is back in the wild, but survivor Laurie Strode is ready for his return. Director David Gordon Green's horror sequel based on John Carpenter's much imitated 1978 namesake movie. With Jamie Lee Curtis, returning to the franchise for the first time since 2002's Halloween Resurrection, Judy Greer and Andi Matichak

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Every year, scammers steal billions from the public and fraud now represents around 40 per cent of all reported crime in the UK. Over the past year, Panorama has had access to Kent Police as their detectives try to catch the fraudsters. With more than 10,000 reports of fraud in the county last year, they estimate that only around 20 cases were solved. The report explores why so few cases are prosecuted and shows how fraudsters target the vulnerable, often using sophisticated techniques to dupe victims into handing over their cash

programme.title: Ronia, Nighean a' Mheirlich/Ronja, the Robber's Daughter
programme.desc: Autumn is here and Ronia and Biorc are worried about winter, which is not far away. Mata appears, offering a home for them

programme.title: An Là (News)

programme.title: Dàn
programme.desc: Eilidh Cormack discusses and reads the poem Thig Trì Nithean Gun Iarraidh by the Daughter of the Laird of Rèilig. She speaks about how its messages are still relevant today

programme.title: Machair
programme.desc: Gaelic soap based on the Isle of Lewis

programme.title: Fraochy Bay
programme.desc: The soldiers of the special forces are still trying to find their way home and a survival expert is keen to share his skills

programme.title: Fianais
programme.desc: John Morrison talks to Charles Johnston about his work as a security consultant in Sudan during the civil war in the 1990s and 2000s. He also talks about his work in New Orleans in the aftermath of Hurricane Katrina in 2005

programme.title: Golf: Mun Cuairt Alba
programme.desc: Pro Stuart Martin shows how to play the challenging 15th hole at North Berwick, called ‘Redan’, and professional coach Keil Beveridge demonstrates his weekly top playing tip

programme.title: Peann a Chlachair/The Stonemason's Pen
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the life of Donald MacLeod, a stonemason from Strathnaver who brought the experiences of his fellow Gaels to an international audience during the Sutherland Clearances - forced displacements of the population of the Scottish Highlands between the 18th and 19th centuries

programme.title: Celtic Connections
programme.desc: Highlights and previously unseen performances by DLÙ and Sorcha Costello

programme.title: Arracht (2019)
programme.desc: As the The Great Hunger progresses, a man unable to protect his family is subsumed by darkness until a helpless little girl saves him from despair. Period drama, starring Dónall Ó Héalaí and Dara Devaney

programme.title: ALT
programme.desc: Including a live performance from Aidan Moffat & RM Hubbert, and chat from Ricky Ross and Dougie Vipond from Deacon Blue. With Dòmhnall Eoghainn Mackinnon

programme.title: Dhan Uisge
programme.desc: Calum Maclean explores the deep waters of Rubislaw Quarry, hidden away in the centre of Aberdeen. The quarry opened in 1740 and about six million tons of granite have been extracted from it. With a depth of 140 metres, this has been said to be the largest hole in the ground in Europe

programme.title: Redemption
programme.desc: Liverpool-based DI Colette Cunningham learns of the death of her estranged daughter Kate , who disappeared without a trace when she was 17 and had been living in Dublin for the past 20 years as Stacey Lockley. Colette is named guardian of her children Cara and Liam and joins the Dublin Central police service, but something about Stacey's final month doesn't seem to add up and Colette sets out to uncover the truth behind her daughter's death. Crime drama, starring Paula Malcomson

programme.title: The 40 Year-Old Virgin (2005)
programme.desc: A middle-aged shop worker reveals he has never been intimate with a woman, which prompts his shocked colleagues to set him up with a series of potentially passionate dates. When he falls for a single mother, his friends think he is right on course for a lusty liaison, but his new partner is not ready for a physical relationship. Judd Apatow's comedy, starring Steve Carell, Catherine Keener and Paul Rudd

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Chef Ainsley Harriott demonstrates recipes with floral flavours, including fragrant chicken kebabs with saffron, cardamom and rose-water rice, and fig, orange blossom and pistachio mille-feuille. April Jackson makes banana bread with rum-soaked raisins served with rum Chantilly cream, and singer Ella Eyre joins Ainsley to cook a pork and mint rice bowl

programme.title: Dare Master @Home
programme.desc: Danny Murphy attempts a dizzy penalty shootout and competes to find out who will stack the highest number of dice in a minute

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. Lloyd's plans with Abacus are ruined when he has to go on a family trip to Caterpillar World, but PB can't wait - she's finally going to find out the gory details of what happens inside a chrysalis! However, the show is not what either of them was expecting...

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. PB has heard that there's a blob of peanut butter on the kitchen counter, but Lloyd's supposed to be maggotsitting and can't leave - faced with the prospect of missing out on the peanut butter, Lloyd therefore concocts a plan to take his maggotsitting duties with him!

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: Brains and Alan visit the Supreme Hadron Collider, but are put in danger when a satellite falls from the sky and heads straight towards them. Virgil flies to the rescue, but discovers an even greater threat - the satellite was being pulled to Earth by a gravity well, which is now pulling in nearby aircraft

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid: Revenge of the Spider Queen
programme.desc: A special episode of the series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. The ancient and evil Spider Queen emerges from her lair - with the help of a shadowy figure, she is supercharged and uses her power to capture the Monkey King and the Demon Bull King. Monkie Kid and his friends team up with Red Son to track down ingredients from the Celestial Realm for an antidote to cure the city's citizens and free it from her destruction.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Monsters and ghouls get in the way of the Scooby gang's adventures as they travel and spend time together in the summer

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. Zoe reveals her list of the funniest boys she knows, but what a disappointment it turns out to be for our heroes - they're not even mentioned! The trio, who consider themselves to be super hilarious, try to convince Zoe of their comic potential, and they even ask for tips from the funniest man in town, who just so happens to be Pedro's grandpa!

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. PJ, Issa and Pedro can't believe their eyes when they find out that the newest hip accessory is a crocodile tooth - being hip is expensive, though, and our pals don't have the cash they need, especially since Issa is saving up to buy a collectible action figure! Simone offers them a space at her booth at the neighbourhood flea market, but what should they do with the money that they earn from it?

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined by Call the Midwife star Laura Main, and Claire Goose, who talks about the new series of The Bay. There are recipes for scallops, chicken, and panna cotta, a masterclass that's perfect for Mother's Day and dishes from chefs Brett Graham, Yottam Ottolenghi and Noor Murad

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours
programme.desc: Chef Ainsley Harriott demonstrates meaty recipes, cooking a breakfast dish of potato rosti with black pudding, poached egg and crispy maple-sriracha bacon. Sam Holland gets a meat masterclass from a butcher and uses what he learns to make a mouth-watering steak sandwich, while TV presenter Richard Madeley reveals the secrets behind a family favourite, which is adding chicken livers to his bolognese

programme.title: James Martin's American Adventure
programme.desc: James enters the Los Angeles in style while driving a vintage Porsche. After a visit to an incredible food market in Santa Monica, he heads to the beach to cook up a storm. He also meets a pensioner who happens to be a fitness coach, drops in on old friend and chef-to-the-stars Wolfgang Puck at his Beverly Hills restaurant CUT and finishes his visit with a bite of his favourite pizza

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: France v Wales (Kick-off 2.45pm). Jill Douglas presents all the action from the match in the final round of fixtures, held at Stade de France. Les Bleus claimed a hard-fought 13-9 win in Cardiff last year en route to the Grand Slam, and although they have not quite hit the same heights this time around, they could still win the title should they win with a bonus point and Ireland lose to England. Wales have endured a difficult campaign, but they did claim a first win last time out away to Italy. With analysis from with Gareth Thomas, Jamie Roberts and Benjamin Kayser, reports by David Flatman, and commentary from Miles Harrison, Shane Williams and Ben Kay

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Ireland v England (Kick-off 5.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the final match of this year's championship, held at Aviva Stadium. Ireland claimed an impressive 32-15 win at Twickenham in last year's competition and another victory this evening would see them win the Grand Slam. In contrast, England have endured a disappointing campaign, defeating Italy and Wales, but suffering home defeats at the hands of Scotland and France, the latter which was a 53-10 thrashing last time out. With analysis from Jonny Wilkinson, Brian O'Driscoll, Rory Best and Clive Woodward, commentary by Nick Mullins, Gordon D'Arcy and Lawrence Dallaglio, and reports from Martin Bayfield

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: Actress Toni Collette is the Star Guest Announcer, Joe Wicks searches for a handyman in I'm a Celebrity Get Out of Me Ear and Jake Shears of Scissor Sisters appears in a disco End of the Show Show. Plus, more surprises and a member of the audience gets the chance to win items advertised in the commercial breaks

programme.title: Starstruck
programme.desc: Olly Murs hosts as four more teams of superfans are transformed into their music idols before stepping onto the stage to sing one of their biggest hits. Panellists Adam Lambert, Shania Twain, Beverley Knight and Jason Manford decide their favourite of the night before the voting audience pick just one person to go through to the series final

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by actor Liam Neeson, actress and Unforgivable host Mel Giedroyc and quick-witted Taskmaster star and stand-up Munya Chawawa. Plus, acclaimed American singer Lady Blackbird performs in the studio

programme.title: ITV News and Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Bradley & Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The actor and his son head to Denmark, where a meeting with some Vikings gives them a great introduction to this famous country before things take a lighter turn as the pair meet a laughter guru. Bradley's fear of heights is pushed to the limit with a visit to the top of an offshore wind turbine with breathtaking views across Copenhagen

Colette is named guardian of her children Cara and Liam and joins the Dublin Central police service, but something about Stacey's final month doesn't seem to add up and Colette sets out to uncover the truth behind her daughter's death. Crime drama, starring Paula Malcomson

However, the show is not what either of them was expecting...

programme.title: Lloyd of the Flies
programme.desc: An animated series about a young fly with a lot to prove. PB has heard that there's a blob of peanut butter on the kitchen counter, but Lloyd's supposed to be maggotsitting and can't leave - faced with the prospect of missing out on the peanut butter, Lloyd therefore concocts a plan to take his maggotsitting duties with him!

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: Brains and Alan visit the Supreme Hadron Collider, but are put in danger when a satellite falls from the sky and heads straight towards them. Virgil flies to the rescue, but discovers an even greater threat - the satellite was being pulled to Earth by a gravity well, which is now pulling in nearby aircraft

programme.title: LEGO Monkie Kid: Revenge of the Spider Queen
programme.desc: A special episode of the series following a young teenager on a mission to save the world. The ancient and evil Spider Queen emerges from her lair - with the help of a shadowy figure, she is supercharged and uses her power to capture the Monkey King and the Demon Bull King. Monkie Kid and his friends team up with Red Son to track down ingredients from the Celestial Realm for an antidote to cure the city's citizens and free it from her destruction.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. Zoe reveals her list of the funniest boys she knows, but what a disappointment it turns out to be for our heroes - they're not even mentioned! The trio, who consider themselves to be super hilarious, try to convince Zoe of their comic potential, and they even ask for tips from the funniest man in town, who just so happens to be Pedro's grandpa!

programme.title: Smarty Pants
programme.desc: Animated comedy series about three kids and their missions from the Great Book of Cooldom. PJ, Issa and Pedro can't believe their eyes when they find out that the newest hip accessory is a crocodile tooth - being hip is expensive, though, and our pals don't have the cash they need, especially since Issa is saving up to buy a collectible action figure! Simone offers them a space at her booth at the neighbourhood flea market, but what should they do with the money that they earn from it?

programme.title: Ainsley's Fantastic Flavours

programme.title: James Martin's American Adventure

programme.title: ITV News and Weather

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: France v Wales (Kick-off 2.45pm). Jill Douglas presents all the action from the match in the final round of fixtures, held at Stade de France. Les Bleus claimed a hard-fought 13-9 win in Cardiff last year en route to the Grand Slam, and although they have not quite hit the same heights this time around, they could still win the title should they win with a bonus point and Ireland lose to England. Wales have endured a difficult campaign, but they did claim a first win last time out away to Italy. With analysis from with Gareth Thomas, Jamie Roberts and Benjamin Kayser, reports by David Flatman, and commentary from Miles Harrison, Shane Williams and Ben Kay

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Ireland v England (Kick-off 5.00pm). Mark Pougatch presents all the action from the final match of this year's championship, held at Aviva Stadium. Ireland claimed an impressive 32-15 win at Twickenham in last year's competition and another victory this evening would see them win the Grand Slam. In contrast, England have endured a disappointing campaign, defeating Italy and Wales, but suffering home defeats at the hands of Scotland and France, the latter which was a 53-10 thrashing last time out. With analysis from Jonny Wilkinson, Brian O'Driscoll, Rory Best and Clive Woodward, commentary by Nick Mullins, Gordon D'Arcy and Lawrence Dallaglio, and reports from Martin Bayfield

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway

Crime drama, starring John Nettles

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: An amateur archaeologist publishes a book about his father's discovery of Celtic artefacts in an ancient mound, and plans a celebration on the site - but landowner Gareth Heldman is less than keen on the idea. While out walking, Joyce spots Heldman arguing with a woman, and hours later he winds up stabbed to death with an old weapon that bears a striking resemblance to the one found during the dig. John Nettles and John Hopkins star

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
